p: T. satureioides is an endemic Moroccan plant, geographically found in the Mediterranean, Thermomediterranean, and Mesomediterranean series, in forest clearings, scrub, matorrals, and low and medium mountains up to 2200â€‰m altitude [ 3, 27]. This species grows on siliceous limestone substratum and rocky to moderately earthy soils in the High Atlas and Anti-Atlas of Morocco. From a climatic point of view, T. satureioides is located in the arid to subhumid bioclimate, with hot, temperate, and fresh variants [ 3].
